The team is brought to a studio for interviews, as each of the characters have shown sufficient ability to be considered for a team. During the interview process the Vermissian Knight, a (rival? Creation?) of Casshan appeared and attempted to disrupt the event! While trying to use their powers to hold the Vermissian Knight, Nullpoint‚Äôs power attracted another version of the Vermissian Knight from an alternate reality, Vermissian Light, looking a bit like a Temu knockoff. After some provocation from Enthalpy and Lady Whiteswallow, Arpeggio was able to convince Vermissian that this could all ‚Äúdisappear‚Äù if they stopped what they were doing. While repeating ‚Äúdisappear‚Äù over and over, the Vermissian Knight disappeared from the scene.

While assessing the situation, The Green Man noticed a horde of people trying to enter the room! Casshan went to engage the horde and was trampled by them as they broke the glass to enter the studio. This horde is the Fiddle Fiends; a group of rabid fans of Arpeggio! Arpeggio‚Äôs handler, ‚ÄúNerd‚Äù, gave them coupons to Arpeggio‚Äôs Cameo which began to placate them. In the mean time, Temo bot‚Äôs arm fell off and exploded, causing harm to one of the Fiddle Fiends which angered Arpeggio. Lady Whiteswallow and the Green Man unleash some water on the Temu bot, shorting some of it‚Äôs circuits. Arpeggio provokes their fan base to go after the robot. Helio sets up some fantastic lighting for Arpeggio to help them out and also take focus off the rest of the team.

Off in another part of the building, Kris is being interviewed by Sharron, the HR rep. They manage to fight off her influence and are brought to the press briefing. Casshan sends their robot dog on Vermissian Light, turning them to a pile of scrap. With the fans placated, we are rushed off to the cafeteria by Sharron where we debrief.

- Recap by Alamose

Welcome to MASKS: Volume 2!

Recap

@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-extensions.sgb30-campaign.tdy9RwRxgTFJoCUN.JournalEntryPage.udkp02MOmJqxvGHd]{MASKS: Vol 1 - Press Briefing}

House Rules / Clarifications

  • @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-extensions.sgb30-campaign.ULCw7XHk0JeF4hwU.JournalEntryPage.wzyXtG6RcyIO15FO]{New Mechanic - Companions}

    • At least 2-3 possible companions will be introduced this session.

  • Players choose which @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.ZknI7Tletbolq2Y2]{Conditions} they take from a move

  • Initiative is Round-based: act whenever you'd like, once per round

    • Spotlight may prompt players when appropriate.@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG]{GM Moves}

  • PVP is valid and in some scenarios appropriate.

  • There is no Long Rest equivalent, but @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.basic-playbook-nova.6NBAc77RalqKzImr]{sharing a vulnerability} may help.

  • Goofs w/ sharing influence are my bad and have been corrected.

New Features

  • XCard Button

    • Configure¬†mode via Settings > Configure Settings > Masks Extensions >X-Card toggle

    • Default: anonymously pings the whole table

    • Always Optional: Provide the GM a reason after clicking.

  • @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.moves.cKdLivE2qMEVFPXt]{Influence} Tools

    • Hover over a token to see Influence

    • Arrow Buttons to update Influence

      • Green: Influence over them

      • Blue: Mutual Influence

      • Purple: Under their Influence

  • Advantage Tool

    • Ongoing: advantage for whole scene

Write my GM reference notes for session 2. Outline where the plot can go.

Keep it high level and cover the what ifs, the foreshadowing, etc so it's really comprehensive.

Add more if you can make it more compelling. Can you find hooks for the characters themselves?

===================

Cold open at the armory

- Prompt level ups

- Everybody discusses what they get at the armory

- They hear alarms going off

- Sharon steps in, arguing with a young superhero, Wendy

- Superhero Wendy wants to go fight crime downtown

- Sharon says it's too dangerous, they're not ready

- Introduce Switchgear, their handler. Calm cool collected

- Wipes away a dead pool on a chalkboard

- Couldn't find 12 of them, Sharon?

Scenario A: Chinatown to fight crime

- Crowd gathers around, taking pictures

- Switchgear wanders off

- Entice players to split up

- Fight the culinary crew - funny, easy encounter

- Trigger The Doomed's doomsign, warn about serious danger.

- Add in various mobs

- Try and divide the party and inflict injuries, particularly to wendy

- If they escape, continue fight at the AEGIS clinic - intruders followed them

- Return to the bunker, find Sharon distraught

Trigger Option B if bored or too heavy

Scenario B: Halcyon City Gala

- Q: Are heroes in or out of uniform?

- People recognize Arpeggio, ask him to perform on stage (separate party)

- Meet Jack, potential love interest

- He's neurodivergent, takes an interest in the outsider or the newborn. Maybe they can be different, together

- Potential for PVP if players bicker (good)

- Young woman bumps into Enthalpy, drops a glass of wine. Prompts Enthalpy to use his powers. If yes, out them as superheroes

- Search the partygoers for anybody suspicious

- Fight with the director, scrumlord, disco bandit, accordion thief

- Switchgear suggests going to chinatown (Trigger A)

Scenario C: Injury / Clinic

- Go back to the clinic

- Talk up the surgical staff

- Suggest Casshan rebuild whoever injured

- Attack the clinic

Hooks for next session

- Where did they come from?

- Why are they hunting them down?

- Who do they take orders from?

here‚Äôs your Session 2 GM reference packet‚Äîclean beats, if/thens, soft/hard move prompts, foreshadowing tags, and character hooks (including Arpeggio & Casshan). Use what serves, toss what doesn‚Äôt. Play to find out. üí•

Session 2: ‚ÄúSirens, Selfies, & Silver Trays‚Äù

Table quick-start

  • Session openers

    • Add +1 Team to the pool. Ask: ‚ÄúWho feels most like the leader today?‚Äù (use when Enter Battle as a Team fires).

    • Prompt advances: ‚ÄúAnyone fill potential last time?‚Äù (misses mark potential; end-of-session growth choices later).

  • Agendas & vibe check (say the quiet part out loud): Make Halcyon feel real. Make their lives interesting. Play to find out. If the table stalls, hard frame into the alarm moment.

  • Influence/Conditions: remind that adults default to Influence; conditions bite the basic moves. Lean on them to steer drama.

Cold Open: The Armory (3‚Äì5 pages)

What we see: metal lockers, gear racks, red emergency strobes; a chalkboard with a ‚Äúdead pool‚Äù scrawl. Switchgear wipes it away: ‚ÄúCouldn‚Äôt find 12 of them, Sharon?‚Äù
NPCs:

  • Switchgear (handler): calm, blank read; plays things down, then vanishes mid-scene.

  • Sharon (AEGIS HR): already arguing with Wendy (eager young hero). Sharon‚Äôs corporate power-moves can redefine stakes mid-scene‚Äîuse Per My Last Email‚Ä¶, Mandatory 1:1, or PIP to split the party, impose scrutiny, or shift a roll down after the fact.

Soft prompts

  • ‚ÄúWhat did you level into?‚Äù (spotlight each choice for a beat; seed how it might complicate today).

  • ‚ÄúWhat do you grab from the armory and why?‚Äù (foreshadow a cost or entanglement).

  • ‚ÄúAlarms blare from downtown.‚Äù Wendy wants to bolt; Sharon forbids it.

Fork the story

  • If the team defies Sharon ‚Üí Scenario A: Chinatown.

  • If they play along / are redirected / want glamor or info-gathering ‚Üí Scenario B: Halcyon City Gala.

  • If someone gets hurt or wants safety ‚Üí Scenario C: Clinic (Injury).

Scenario A: Chinatown‚ÄîCrowds, Cooks, & Chaos

Set-up beats

  1. Arrive to a dense, phone-wielding crowd; news-choppers; neon signs and steam vents.

  2. Switchgear wanders off (seed suspicion). Encourage the team to split: fans, alleys, rooftops, kitchen backdoor. (Ask ‚Äúwho‚Äôs taking point on civilians?‚Äù ‚Üí trigger Assess/Defend as needed.)

  3. The Culinary Crew (funny, low-threat villains): ladles-as-axes, noodle nets, grease traps, improvised wok-shields. Keep it light, fast, collateral-prone.

Make it Masks

  • When fists fly, Enter Battle as a Team (build/trim Team, align purpose, call out mistrust).

  • Use crowd-as-threat: deploy Fiddle Fiends (Arpeggio‚Äôs groupies) as a roaming hazard that knocks heroes prone, overshadows non-Arpeggio heroes, and weaponizes selfies to inflict Insecure or create Janus/secret-ID complications. Moves: Mosh Pit, Riding His Coat Tails, But First‚Ä¶Let Me Take a Selfie.

  • If anyone‚Äôs drowning in attention, let Arpeggio pop Time for the Show (onlookers watching), or lean the Audience demands hard‚Äîclear a condition by accepting their label, or mark potential on a hit rejecting it (and expect blowback).

Spice the fight

  • Light villains trade blows; the mob creates opportunities and collateral (slip hazards, scalding broth). Directly Engage triggers; if you want harm to sting, call Take a Powerful Blow.

  • Wendy is a magnet for danger. On a 6-, injure her (non-lethal), forcing choices: protect vs pursue.

Escalation paths

  • If they win cleanly: the Culinary Crew flees through a clinic transport tunnel ‚Üí Scenario C.

  • If they reposition/retreat with civilians: AEGIS Clinic triage ‚Üí Scenario C.

  • If stakes feel heavy or mood is dragging: smash-cut to Scenario B (Gala) as a ‚Äúpublic commendation invite‚Äù or ‚Äúdamage-control PR‚Äù‚ÄîSharon re-frames the day and ushers them to the gala.

Scenario B: The Halcyon City Gala‚ÄîMasks Off?

Questions to ask out loud

  • ‚ÄúAre you in costume or in civvies?‚Äù (labels & secrecy matter; prep Mild-Mannered/Pierce/Provoke/Comfort moments).

  • ‚ÄúWho here do you want to impress?‚Äù (Queue Star/Legacy-ish energy even if you don‚Äôt have one.)

Spotlights

  • Arpeggio: Guests recognize him; asked to perform. If he performs: Time for the Show; name 2 NPCs who now owe him or complicate him. If he refuses: Audience demands escalate (clear/mark per Star move results).

  • Jack (potential LI): neurodivergent, sincerely curious; clicks with Outsider or Newborn (if present)‚Äî‚ÄúMaybe we can be different, together.‚Äù Offer a quiet balcony scene (great for Comfort or Support / Team Moves).

  • Enthalpy wine-spill prompt (if that PC exists): choice to use powers publicly ‚Üí out them (rolls cascade: Unleash risk, then social fallout via Influence/labels).

Villainy at black-tie

  • Small, stylish fracas: The Director, Scrumlord, Disco Bandit, Accordion Thief.

    • Use The Director to meta-cut scenes: Cut! (re-take a move at -2 or keep and mark 2 conditions), Inspired by Tarantino (everyone marks a condition; style your move for a bonus), Director‚Äôs Cut (bring back a ‚Äúsolved‚Äù hazard). He‚Äôs perfect to punish splits, or goose pacing.

  • Switchgear whispers: ‚ÄúChinatown is flaring up again.‚Äù If energy dips or party gets messy ‚Üí Trigger A pivot.

Scenario C: The Clinic‚ÄîWhite Coats, Red Flags

Tone: fluorescent kindness with militarized logistics. Doctors are competent and warm; security is cold.

Beats

  1. Talk up the surgical staff. Offer Casshan a hard temptation: ‚ÄúWith your mind, you could rebuild what was damaged.‚Äù (Always Prepared gadgets; Scientific Insight-style logic if you want to frame it; swing hard into ethics and consequence).

  2. Attack on the clinic. Infiltrators followed them (or were already inside). Lights cut, auto-doors lock, someone‚Äôs in the OR. Defend, Unleash, Assess, then Enter Battle as a Team as alarms cascade.

  3. If The Doomed is on the team, drop a Doomsign: visions of a sealed surgical wing, or a name (‚ÄúVermissian‚Äù). If not, echo it through Casshan‚Äôs Shame: a file, a silhouette, or an inhuman gait on the cameras‚ÄîThe Vermissian Knight exists‚Ä¶in some form. Pushing Casshan‚Äôs shame: mark a condition or shift Superior‚Üì / Danger‚Üë if confronted.

Outcomes

  • AEGIS asset or AEGIS trap? If they save the day but make a mess, Sharon arrives with a PIP-style review. If they cooperate, gain an asset; if they resist, escalate adult attention later.

GM move kit (drop-in)

  • Soft: announce future badness (siren routes; camera flashes), put someone in a spot (Wendy under a scaffolding), show costs of collateral (grease fire spreads), offer an opportunity with a cost (backstage access if Arpeggio ‚Äúperforms‚Äù a statement).

  • Hard: separate them, take away their stuff (signal jammers), inflict a condition (Insecure via headlines; Angry via heckling), or turn their move back on them (The Director‚Äôs ‚ÄúCut!‚Äù or Sharon‚Äôs paperwork).

Character-specific hooks

Arpeggio ‚Äî The Star (sonic control; audience machine)

  • Scene candy

    • Chinatown: the Fiddle Fiends worship you but endanger others‚Äîchoose: bask (buff yourself, overshadow the team) or redirect them (Comfort the crowd to clear their ‚ÄúInsecure‚Äù cascade).

    • Gala performance: use Time for the Show; NPCs must admire/help/ask something big. If you reject your audience‚Äôs label, mark potential on a hit and invite retribution (paparazzi calls; ‚ÄúWere you lip-syncing?‚Äù).

  • Pressure levers: audience demands perfection and major heroics; a stumble fuels Insecure/Guilty and PR strings attached to any help. (That‚Äôs your Audience extra.)

  • If you share triumph: is it part of the show or not? Shift Labels / clear a condition accordingly. Great after a rooftop duet or mid-fight riff.

Casshan ‚Äî The Brain (genius; robotic sidekick; Shame = Vermissian Knight)

  • Scene candy

    • Clinic temptation: surgeons ask for a miracle prosthesis in minutes; spend gadget hold to pull a device, but mark a condition at 0 gadgets.

    • Shame Foreshadow: security footage shows a flesh-steel silhouette stepping between frames. Confrontation = either mark a condition or shift Superior‚Üì Danger‚Üë.

  • Team economy: Above the Fray adds Team when you advise the leader; you can contradict later to add more (and stir drama). Perfect when Sharon ‚Äúaudits‚Äù a teammate and you step in‚Äîor cut their mic.

  • Debrief: later, downplay your help (mark potential) or exaggerate (clear a condition) and adjust Influence. Slot this after the gala photo op.

Plug-and-play hooks if you have them

  • The Doomed: a Doomsign vision at the clinic: a countdown overlay on the operating theater door; mark doom to ask ‚ÄúWhat happens if I open it?‚Äù

  • The Janus: selfie swarm (Fiddle Fiends) threatens secret identity; Mild-Mannered can thread the needle or blow up in your face.

  • The Outsider/Newborn: Jack asks achingly literal questions about humanity; Comfort or Support with Freak instead of Mundane (if using Outsider moves), or write a Newborn lesson mid-scene.

Foreshadowing & mysteries (plant 2‚Äì3)

  • ‚ÄúCouldn‚Äôt find 12 of them, Sharon?‚Äù

    • Missing: twelve prototypes (limb cassettes Casshan scrapped), or twelve Culinary Crew line cooks who never clocked out, or twelve ‚Äòaudience members‚Äô who follow Arpeggio across city grids like a simulation glitch.

  • Why are they hunting the team?

    • a) Scrumlord auctions teen-hero footage; the team is click-bait.

    • b) The Director is paid to manufacture a ‚Äúfall from grace‚Äù arc (he can bring back resolved complications).

    • c) AEGIS internal audit (Sharon) wants leverage to either own the team or shut them down; she frames saves as policy violations.

  • Who gives the orders?

    • Accordion Thief plays courier for a voice called ‚ÄúThe Sommelier‚Äù‚Äîpairings of heroes and disasters are curated.

    • Vermissian signal from the clinic sub-basement pings across time (Casshan‚Äôs shame); a director needs a monster in Act 3.

Pacing toggles (use anytime)

  • Too heavy? Hard cut to a gala interview bit (two questions, one microphone): PCs pick Provoke or Comfort to steer the headline.

  • Too silly? Power fails at the clinic; heartbeat monitor flatlines in the OR. Defend with consequences.

  • Party split? Use The Director to literally split the comic into panels and make each side pay a cost to re-sync. ‚ÄúCut!‚Äù forces retakes/conditions; ‚ÄúAnd‚Ä¶ action!‚Äù spikes enemy tempo.

Concluding images (choose your tag)

  • Back at the bunker, Sharon is distraught‚Äîshakes clutch of forms: ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt policy. This is‚Ä¶orders.‚Äù Who signed them? (Seed next session villain.)

  • Clinic: an empty gurney, restraints sliced clean; a silhouette on the cam at times that don‚Äôt exist. (Casshan hook.)

  • Gala: glitter confetti falls into a police skirmish line; a slow clap from The Director as he exits through a service corridor.

End-of-session wrap

  • Run the end-of-session move: closer to team / into own image / away from team. Resolve Influence shifts & conditions. Queue a debrief montage (great for Mission Debrief or Team Moves).

One-card NPC cheatlines

  • Sharon (AEGIS HR): reframes fiction with paperwork; splits parties; ‚Äúhelp‚Äù with strings; escalates to adult attention. (Use Per My Last Email, Mandatory 1:1, PIP.)

  • Fiddle Fiends (Mob): adore Arpeggio; endanger everyone; selfies inflict Insecure; stampede threatens civilians.

  • The Director: meta-villain who edits your comic; forces retakes, amps style, resurrects solved problems. Great when players split or momentum wobbles.

If you want, I can turn this into a printable one-page scene flow (A/B/C arrows + triggers) and a half-page NPC move strip for your GM screen next.
